subject: Sales
title: Apple: Selling Identity Over Specs
description: A quick, practical guide to Apple: Selling Identity Over Specs.

hook.text: Apple fans camp outside stores for phones with specs competitors matched months ago. Why?

buildup.text: Apple sells identity. Owning an iPhone says something about who you are, not just what you have.

discovery.text: Think Different positioned Apple as the brand for creative rebels. Identity outsold features entirely.

twist.text: Apple's specs aren't always the best. Yet its brand loyalty is the strongest in all of technology.

climax.text: When you sell an identity, price becomes secondary. Belonging is something buyers pay premium for.

punchline.text: Apple sells who you are, not what you get.

quiz.question: What does Apple primarily sell to its customers?
options: An identity and sense of belonging
